AI/AI.title: AI
AI/AI.description: - The conspiracy to make AI harder than it is!

AI/AI Strategy.title: AI Strategy
AI/AI Strategy.description: AI strategy is about having a clear view of how to enable the organization to utilize AI capabilities. An AI strategy should encompass the following subsets of strategies.

AI/Data Drift.title: Data Drift
AI/Data Drift.description: Data drift refers to the phenomenon where the statistical properties of a dataset used for machine learning or analysis change over time. This alteration can be due to various factors such as shifts in data collection processes, changes in the underlying distribution of the data, or modifications in the environment from which the data originates. Detecting and addressing data drift is crucial to maintaining the performance and reliability of machine learning models and analytical systems.

AI/Data Science/Data Science.title: Data Science
AI/Data Science/Data Science.description: What is data science? It is a bunch of different jobs bunched together and given the tie of AI to make a company sound innovative.

AI/Data Science/Data Science Project Sta.id: AI/Data Science/Data Science Project Start-Up Phase
AI/Data Science/Data Science Project Sta.title: Data Science Project Start-Up Phase
AI/Data Science/Data Science Project Sta.description: The start-up phase of a data science project is for me one of the most exciting parts of the project, but it is also one of the most unclear phases. To have a fighting chance of making it to production, there are several factors that are extremely important and need to be addressed.

AI/Data Science/ML Design Sprint.title: ML Design Sprint
AI/Data Science/ML Design Sprint.description: The ML Design Sprint is a modification of the design sprint workshop, where the goal is to give the project relevant context on the problem, the data, and the resources available. The goal of the ML Design Sprint is to decide on the goal of the model, the input features of the model, and how the model should be evaluated. The design sprint brings together Subject Matter Experts, Users, Product Owners Data Scientists, and ML Engineers together to quickly understand the problem, the potential solutions, and the risks. ML Design Sprint should shorten the duration of the scoping and exploratory analysis phases by bringing the analysts and experts together.

AI/Data Science/Recommendation Systems.title: Recommendation Systems
AI/Data Science/Recommendation Systems.description: There are two types of recommendation systems

AI/Language/NLP or LLM.title: NLP
AI/Language/NLP or LLM.description: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is using machine learning techniques to work with text.

Articles/Articles.title: Articles
Articles/Articles.description: List of interesting articles. I'm looking forward to seeing some of the articles I read and checking if they stood the test of time.

Books/Book Reviews/1776.description: Book contians the storeis of Washington and the continental army through the tumultuous year of 1776. It paints a bleak picture of an overmatched rebel army that where not up to the standards. Furthermore, if not for the stoic preserverance of George washington or the courage of some of his inexperienced but promising generals the world history would be quite different.

Books/Book Reviews/5 Love Languages.title: 5 Love Languages
Books/Book Reviews/5 Love Languages.description: The book defines 5 different ways we need affection from our loved ones. It covers how you can identify which love language your significant other uses and how to strengthen love by talking to them in their language. It does this by using examples of love languages or dialects and shows how others have used them to a great extent.

Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Progr.id: Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Progr.title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Progr.description: This book is a collection of 97 software engineering tips and advice from experts in the field. It contains non-technical advice, technical advice and thoughts from a pretty large corpus of experience.

Books/Book Reviews/A Field Guide to Lies.id: Books/Book Reviews/A Field Guide to Lies
Books/Book Reviews/A Field Guide to Lies.title: A Field Guide to Lies
Books/Book Reviews/A Field Guide to Lies.description: This book is akin to calling bullshit, where it goes through all the ways people fool themselves and others. The book might make you too aware and skeptical of everything.

Books/Book Reviews/A little Hatred.title: A little Hatred
Books/Book Reviews/A little Hatred.description: The thrilling sequel to the first Law and its follow-up books. Set in an industrial revolution age, class struggle, money, and power are keywords. The characters are fascinating and funny in that you can see their faults even by following their perspective.

Books/Book Reviews/A Mind for Numbers Ho.id: Books/Book Reviews/A Mind for Numbers How to Excel at Math and Science
Books/Book Reviews/A Mind for Numbers Ho.title: A Mind for Numbers How to Excel at Math and Science

Books/Book Reviews/A Story of Us.title: A Story of Us
Books/Book Reviews/A Story of Us.description: It is about the evolution of us, starting from where we separated from the other apes. It is fun and engaging and tries to make stories of how premodern people are behaving.

Books/Book Reviews/Alchemy.title: Alchemy
Books/Book Reviews/Alchemy.description: This book is about the lack of knowledge and the dangers of trying to be "too" scientific.  It goes into the different aspects of human nature that is difficult to explain.

Books/Book Reviews/Animal Farm.title: Animal Farm
Books/Book Reviews/Animal Farm.description: The animal farm animals are free, having rebelled and expelled their human masters. Working hard under the leadership of the pigs Snowball and Napoleon, the animals toil and work harder than ever. At least all animals are equal, but some are more equal than others.

Books/Book Reviews/Automating Your Mac.title: Automating Your Mac
Books/Book Reviews/Automating Your Mac.description: This book is about automation in the Mac sphere. The book goes through some cool automation. Most of it is pretty unconvincing.

Books/Book Reviews/Basic Economics.title: Basic Economics
Books/Book Reviews/Basic Economics.description: Prices work, and competition works; if someone wants to limit the free market, it is usually a good indicator that they want to make money on it.

Books/Book Reviews/Best served Cold.title: Best served Cold
Books/Book Reviews/Best served Cold.description: The book is set in a different place than the first law, but a lot of the characters from the first law series are there and it is very much connected. It follows a mercenary woman and her quest for revenge. It is filled with betrayals.

Books/Book Reviews/Black Boy.title: Black Boy
Books/Book Reviews/Black Boy.description: This book depicts, from a young boy to a young man's perspective, the journey from Jim Crow South to Chicago and the trials from the communist party. It is a gripping read, where the main character is never comfortable in his environment, constantly struggling for the right to exist as an individual.  Freedom all look the same, but oppression has many faces.

Books/Book Reviews/Books.title: Books
Books/Book Reviews/Books.description: I think books are a good way to engage yourself in something completely. It is one of my favorite ways to learn and understand things, and I want to be able to read every day.

Books/Book Reviews/Calling Bullshit.title: Calling Bullshit
Books/Book Reviews/Calling Bullshit.description: This book is all about the BS. It is split into defining, identifying, and calling bullshit in the modern world. It is an easy read, with good examples and a skeptical eye on everything.

Books/Book Reviews/Crucial Conversations.id: Books/Book Reviews/Crucial Conversations Tools for Talking When Stakes are High
Books/Book Reviews/Crucial Conversations.title: Crucial Conversations Tools for Talking When Stakes are High
Books/Book Reviews/Crucial Conversations.description: This book is about identifying and navigating crucial moments in communication and getting to the desired end state. It goes through the identifiers of crucial conversations, gives advice on how to identify issues for yourself and others, and finally tries to make the reader understand how they should behave to get to the desired end state.

Books/Book Reviews/Designing Machine Lea.title: Designing Machine Learning Systems
Books/Book Reviews/Designing Machine Lea.description: This book covers the fundamentals of designing machine learning systems. It goes through the entire lifecycle of a machine learning system and then discusses the ecosystem and the challenges and cases that need to be considered.

Books/Book Reviews/Economics in One Less.title: Economics in One Lesson
Books/Book Reviews/Economics in One Less.description: This book is about prices and the fact that the economic machine should not be tampered with. It is a classic Austrian school of Economics type of book, and contains the usual arguments from that school. It uses 200 pages to conclude that you should not tamper with it.

Books/Book Reviews/Eisenhorn.title: Eisenhorn
Books/Book Reviews/Eisenhorn.description: A fantasy set in the 40k universe. The book is about the adventures of Eisenhorn the Inquisitor and his retinue. It is fantasy through and through but fun and engaging through 3 stories.

Books/Book Reviews/Expert Python Program.title: Expert Python Programming
Books/Book Reviews/Expert Python Program.description: A book about advanced Python concepts. Nice to learn about more advanced Python concepts.

Books/Book Reviews/Extreme Ownership.title: Extreme Ownership
Books/Book Reviews/Extreme Ownership.description: Leif and Jocko go through their combat experiences in combat and the lessons in leadership that they have learned from them. They break down concepts, explain why they are important for the SEALS, and highlight them in the business context as well.

Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks T.id: Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks Time Management for Mortals
Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks T.title: Four Thousand Weeks Time Management for Mortals
Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks T.description: This book takes all the productivity and self-help books and asks if we should take a step back and not be captives of our ambitions. This book is for those who try too hard to be 10X'ers and feel demotivated by their lack of results.

Books/Book Reviews/Fundamentals of Data.title: Fundamentals of Data Engineering
Books/Book Reviews/Fundamentals of Data.description: This book covers the fundamentals of data engineering and how to solve problems. of data engineering without going to much into detail of the programming. It introduces concepts such as data warehouse and Kafka and data pipelines and ETL.

Books/Book Reviews/Hitch 22.title: Hitch 22
Books/Book Reviews/Hitch 22.description: The memoirs of the immaculate Christopher Hitchens. From birth to almost the end, it is never a boring story of a man who witnessed the history of the political world in the 20th century. From bohemian soixante-huitard to the aftermath of the Iraq war, Hitchens is always championing what he believes to be the rational truth.

Books/Book Reviews/How the war was Won.id: Books/Book Reviews/How the war was Won
Books/Book Reviews/How the war was Won.title: How the war was Won
Books/Book Reviews/How the war was Won.description: This book systematically cuts through all the bravado and battlefield-centric focus of World War 2 history and focuses on the things that mattered. Manufacturing, logistics, and control over the air-sea theatre. It also provides insight into how the leaders of both the Axis powers as well as the Allies thought and how they argued against themselves, for better or worse.

Books/Book Reviews/How the World Really.id: Books/Book Reviews/How the World Really Works
Books/Book Reviews/How the World Really.title: How the World Really Works
Books/Book Reviews/How the World Really.description: This book is for the naturalist and realists that are concerned about the environment. It goes through the most critical things that drive our modern society, cement, steel, ammonia and plastic, and goes through what it takes to produce said elements. You don't get that enthusiastic about a zero-oil society by reading it.

Books/Book Reviews/I Moved Your Cheese.title: I Moved Your Cheese
Books/Book Reviews/I Moved Your Cheese.description: This book is a fairy tale about mice and labyrinths. The characters of Max, Big, and Zed are musing on the fact that the mice are all in the maze and looking for cheese when there is no one asking why the cheese is always being moved around.

Books/Book Reviews/Imagined Communities.title: Imagined Communities
Books/Book Reviews/Imagined Communities.description: It is a kinda of half Marxist, half academic book about how language primarily shaped nation-states and how written language is the primary factor of nationalism. Imagined comities, aka the nation as a concept, are shaped by languages.

Books/Book Reviews/Kvitekrist.title: Kvitekrist
Books/Book Reviews/Kvitekrist.description: This book is about the life of Olav Haraldson, also known as Olav the Holy. This book offers a glimpse into how the Viking Age was. Mostly, it shows the strife and warfare that shaped history and how the impressions of the writers shape the historical narrative.

Books/Book Reviews/Learn Google Flutter.title: Learn Google Flutter Fast
Books/Book Reviews/Learn Google Flutter.description: This book is basically an introduction guide to google flutter and how to best start working with it. It goes through dart, flutter widgets, and state management, as well as other things. It gives example code as well as images of the apps created by the code.

Books/Book Reviews/Letters to a Young Co.id: Books/Book Reviews/Letters to a Young Contrarian
Books/Book Reviews/Letters to a Young Co.title: Letters to a Young Contrarian
Books/Book Reviews/Letters to a Young Co.description: This book is about being right, not being in the crowd etc. It is advice on how to stay true to the principles. The letters are thoughtful and engaging.

Books/Book Reviews/Machine Learning Desi.title: Machine Learning Design Patterns
Books/Book Reviews/Machine Learning Desi.description: This book is about machine learning design patterns and discussions around those—concepts in machine learning for this. And therefore, it is a good reminder of the concepts and core tenants of machine learning.

Books/Book Reviews/Made to Stick.title: Made to Stick
Books/Book Reviews/Made to Stick.description: This book describes the underlying reasons why an idea sticks. It goes through the concreteness, unexpectedness, and credibility of an idea and how it affects how well an idea sticks. It goes through interesting cases and highlights reasons why these ideas have become ingrained in our collective minds.

Books/Book Reviews/Models.title: Models
Books/Book Reviews/Models.description: This book is about dating for men. But it is an honest book, that says that you should start with yourself and become a person people likes and you are comfortable with. Real men are vulnerable and in charge of their feelings.

Books/Book Reviews/Moneyball.title: Moneyball
Books/Book Reviews/Moneyball.description: How statistics revolutionized baseball. Goes into detail about the famous (now movie) season of the Oakland A´s season and why and how they succeeded despite a pitiful budget. It highlights our human faults and how some can benefit greatly from exploiting other people´s biases.

Books/Book Reviews/On Palestine.title: On Palestine
Books/Book Reviews/On Palestine.description: This book is a critique of the horrendous way Israel has treated the Palestinians. It delves into all the classical arguments on the situations and dispels them. Their main argument is that Palestinians have as much of a right to their land as the Israelis.

Books/Book Reviews/Payments Systems in t.id: Books/Book Reviews/Payments Systems in the US
Books/Book Reviews/Payments Systems in t.title: Payments Systems in the US

Books/Book Reviews/Peopleware.title: Peopleware
Books/Book Reviews/Peopleware.description: This book addresses the elephant in the software room, that people, not tech, are the obstacle. Tech is just there to be applied; solving the problem requires a lot of people and knowledge to go the right way. It also addresses how to solve this problem for humans.

Books/Book Reviews/Personal MBA.title: Personal MBA
Books/Book Reviews/Personal MBA.description: A book with small but interesting stories and lessons. It is meant to concretize a master in business and administration into a single magnum opus. Its lessons are short but interesting.

Books/Book Reviews/Practical MLOps.title: Practical MLOps
Books/Book Reviews/Practical MLOps.description: This book is a no-nonsense book about practical MLOps and how you should approach it to solve business problems. The book takes an even more hardline approach to automation and focuses on the concept of Kaizen ML, where continuous improvement and striving to make the feedback loop even shorter and the process more and more seamless.

Books/Book Reviews/Practical Recommendat.title: Practical Recommendation Systems
Books/Book Reviews/Practical Recommendat.description: This book is an easy and good introduction to recommendation systems. It is meant to introduce the concept of recommendation systems and, from there, give concepts and methods on how to make them. This book is about usage rather than the theoretical background.

Books/Book Reviews/Pricing and Revenue O.title: Pricing and Revenue Optimization
Books/Book Reviews/Pricing and Revenue O.description: It is a book about price optimization as well as revenue management. It consists of multiple ways to do price optimization and deals with techniques from the industry.

Books/Book Reviews/Python Tricks.title: Python Tricks
Books/Book Reviews/Python Tricks.description: This book is just a lot of neet tricks to use in python.  It contains knowledge about structures in python, wrappers to use, and a lot of lot more. Nice for a developer with some python knowledge.

Books/Book Reviews/Red Country.title: Red Country
Books/Book Reviews/Red Country.description: It is a fantasy book that takes inspiration from the Wild West area, with impulses from a lot of different settings from previous books. Mostly a story about traveling and challenges, as well as a few twists and turns. Mostly a book that is easy to read.

Books/Book Reviews/Red Famine.title: Red Famine
Books/Book Reviews/Red Famine.description: Sometimes a book makes you physically ill just by reading it. This is the case of the Holomodor, where the genocide of the Ukranian people and its perpetrates are described in Red Famine. The worst parts were the denials and the justifications.

Books/Book Reviews/Slaughterhouse Five.title: Slaughterhouse Five
Books/Book Reviews/Slaughterhouse Five.description: The book is about war, and imprisonment. It is written in an absurd matter which hides the traumas the person experience. It is an antiwar novel that is written as a comedy.

Books/Book Reviews/Soul in the Game.title: Soul in the Game
Books/Book Reviews/Soul in the Game.description: What is a meaningful life? Vitali takes on his journey filled with wisdom and experiences and tells beautiful stories that resonate. Topics such as life, wisdom, writing, and classical music are taken up with humor, emotion, and clarity.

Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutiona.id: Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain
Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutiona.title: Spark The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain
Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutiona.description: Spark is basically about how exercise is good for your brain as well as your body. Most of the book tells in allegories how exercise helps people become more focused and that by stopping exercising we are losing out on important functions for the brain as well as the body.

Books/Book Reviews/Stoner.title: Stoner
Books/Book Reviews/Stoner.description: Stoner portrays the life of William Stoner, from a young man and student to a professor in Literature. The book portrays the small things and trivial conflicts and relationships in life.

Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Autom.id: Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Automating Your Mac
Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Autom.title: Take Control of Automating Your Mac
Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Autom.description: This book is about cool and fast ways you can automate your Mac experience. It goes over the most important things you can automate, with a strong focus on Mac apps. It goes deeper into automation such as Keyboard Maestro

Books/Book Reviews/The blade Itself.title: The blade Itself
Books/Book Reviews/The blade Itself.description: This is the introductory. book in the first law series/world. It is the begining of the adventure of the main heroes of the first law triology. Most of it pertains to mundane tasks and world building.

Books/Book Reviews/The Blind Watchmaker.title: The Blind Watchmaker
Books/Book Reviews/The Blind Watchmaker.description: This book goes deep on evolution and explains how evolution is not random but rather an unconciusly driven thing that shapes the creatues. Dawkins eloquently dismisses arguments that darwinian evolution is random and that complexity cannot arrive by small steps and explains how it happes.

Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipp.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipping Container Made the World Smaller and the World Economy Bigger
Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipp.title: The Box How the Shipping Container Made the World Smaller and the World Economy Bigger
Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipp.description: This book contains the story of the container. It describes how it was first implemented, why it worked, and how the different actors behaved about the new innovation. The container shaped international trade more than anything else in the 20th century, and this is the story of how it came to be.

Books/Book Reviews/The Brothers Karamazo.title: The Brothers Karamazov
Books/Book Reviews/The Brothers Karamazo.description: It is a book that involves morality, love, and spirituality. It is a crime story with the morals of the characters being put on trial.

Books/Book Reviews/The Capitalist Manife.title: The Capitalist Manifesto
Books/Book Reviews/The Capitalist Manife.description: This book is a homage to the progress that capitalism has brought. It is an interesting comparison to the doom and gloom books. It is a book about the fantastic increase in wealth and prosperity that capitalism has brought.

Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against Real.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against Reality Why Evolution Hid the Truth from Our Eyes
Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against Real.title: The Case Against Reality Why Evolution Hid the Truth from Our Eyes

Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against the.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against the Sexual Revolution
Books/Book Reviews/The Case Against the.title: The Case Against the Sexual Revolution

Books/Book Reviews/The Creativity Code.title: The Creativity Code
Books/Book Reviews/The Creativity Code.description: This book is about how creativity is entering a new age where AI and machine learning enhances and sometimes surpass human creativity. It is about what creativity is at its core. And it is about how

Books/Book Reviews/The Dictator's Handbo.title: The Dictator's Handbook
Books/Book Reviews/The Dictator's Handbo.description: Nobody rules alone. In order to rule you need to reward your supporters. Everyone who wastes money is likely to be replaced by those who don't.  The more concentrated your supporting groups are, the more power is given to them.

Books/Book Reviews/The First World War.title: The First World War
Books/Book Reviews/The First World War.description: This book is about the history of the great world war. It covers the major strategic themes and goes in-depth on the conflicts outside of the Western front. It is a book that focuses on the war and only the war.

Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Futu.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Future The Visionary Life of John von Neumann
Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Futu.title: The Man from the Future The Visionary Life of John von Neumann
Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Futu.description: This book is about the fascinating life of John von Neumann. It describes the work and the ramifications of the work he ventured on. Things like game theory, the biology of cell automata, economics, physics, mathematics, and computer science are all fields either founded or drastically influenced by the work of John von Neumann.

Books/Book Reviews/The Myth of Sisyphus.title: The Myth of Sisyphus
Books/Book Reviews/The Myth of Sisyphus.description: Albert Camus is talking about the existence of good and the absence of meaning. The goal is to rebel against the existentialist.

Books/Book Reviews/The Quants.title: The Quants
Books/Book Reviews/The Quants.description: This is a history book of people who revolutionized finance with math, game theory, and computers to model how the market work. However, the real world is not a model, and quants are also humans, as the financial crisis showed.

Books/Book Reviews/The Stranger.title: The Stranger
Books/Book Reviews/The Stranger.description: One of Albert Camus's greatest works. It tells the story of the main character from such a distant and objective point that the reader gets taken by the meaninglessness of it all. It is a damning view of the way we strive for meaning in an absurd universe.

Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scie.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scie.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scie.description: This book examines what constitutes a "scientific revolution". The book goes into detail, with some specific examples covering Copernicus's heliocentric theory of astronomy, Lavoiser´s gas theory and Røntgen´s x-ray theory.  It covers what the background for each was and tries to find some common criteria for a scientific revolution.

Books/Book Reviews/The Triumph of Seeds.title: The Triumph of Seeds
Books/Book Reviews/The Triumph of Seeds.description: This book is about seeds from trees. How did they evolve? How did they flourish? What causes them to be like they are?

Books/Book Reviews/The Trouble with Peac.title: The Trouble with Peace
Books/Book Reviews/The Trouble with Peac.description: Manipulation, rebellion, and weak characters. This book has a good way of describing a changing society and its interests and their manipulations. You can see how characters shaped by honor lose to those who will stop at nothing to gain power.

Books/Book Reviews/The Wim Hof Method.title: The Wim Hof Method
Books/Book Reviews/The Wim Hof Method.description: Breathing is apparently all you need. It can cure anxiety, hangovers, MS, and much more. Also, Ice baths are good as well and the core temperature can be manipulated.

Books/Book Reviews/The Wisdom of Crowds.title: The Wisdom of Crowds
Books/Book Reviews/The Wisdom of Crowds.description: Last book (for now) in the first law series. It is a good and interesting fantasy book in that it emulates the French Revolution. I quite liked it and how it portrays a turbulent age where power dictates the fate of life.

Books/Book Reviews/Thinking in Systems.title: Thinking in Systems
Books/Book Reviews/Thinking in Systems.description: This book is about understanding and conveying how the system works and how you can use systems thinking to understand the world differently. Systems have mechanisms that govern their behavior, and system thinking allows you to model how the system behaves when manipulating it.

Books/Book Reviews/Washington's Spies. T.id: Books/Book Reviews/Washington's Spies. The Story of America's First Spy Ring
Books/Book Reviews/Washington's Spies. T.title: Washington's Spies. The Story of America's First Spy Ring
Books/Book Reviews/Washington's Spies. T.description: This is a book that takes the human stories of living life during the revolutionary war. It shows how America´s first real spy ring was formed and how they used deception, cunning, and wit to deliver intelligence. It also gives insights into the motivations of the people who choose to rebel against the British or to preserve the British empire in the colonies.

Books/Book Reviews/When Reason goes on H.id: Books/Book Reviews/When Reason goes on Holliday
Books/Book Reviews/When Reason goes on H.title: When Reason goes on Holliday

Books/Book Reviews/Why Orwell Matters.title: Why Orwell Matters
Books/Book Reviews/Why Orwell Matters.description: Hitchens calmly and effectively demolishes the right, the left, and all others who have taken Orwell's name in vain. He delves into the absurd scenarios in 1984 and Animal Farm and highlights the same exact scenarios from real-life scenarios.  Imperialism, Fascism, and Communism, the great calamities of the 19th century, are shown through the lens of Orwell, and also how he always lands on the right side of history.

Books/Book Reviews/Why we get fat and wh.id: Books/Book Reviews/Why we get fat and what to do about it
Books/Book Reviews/Why we get fat and wh.title: Why we get fat and what to do about it

Books/Book Reviews/Word by Word.title: Word by Word
Books/Book Reviews/Word by Word.description: It's a book about dictionaries.  It contains how dictionaries are made (very nerdy) and how the history of words has been shaped by a multitude of factors. Also, how silent it is at dictionary workshops.

Books/Book Reviews/Your Brain at Work.title: Your Brain at Work
Books/Book Reviews/Your Brain at Work.description: This book is about how you can understand and work on your performance by understanding how the brain works. The book goes through different scenarios and explains why the persons in the scenario do what they do and what they can do to achieve better results.  The book contains helpful hints about how to "hack" your brain to achieve better results and improve your life.

Books/Book Reviews/Zen & The Art of Moto.id: Books/Book Reviews/Zen & The Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
Books/Book Reviews/Zen & The Art of Moto.title: Zen & The Art of Motorcycle Maintenance

Books/Literature/Literature.title: Literature
Books/Literature/Literature.description: This section is about the fine arts of literature and how I relate to them. I will use this section mostly as a way for me to relate to the great works.

Books/Literature/Poems.title: Poems
Books/Literature/Poems.description: I think good poems are powerful in a way books cannot be. It is the young man's game, and its simplicity is in itself artful.

Career/Career.title: Career
Career/Career.description: Here I write about career and about how to better oneself in one's career.

Cloud/AWS.title: AWS
Cloud/AWS.description: - SST AWS for Typescript in 100 seconds

Cloud/GCP.title: GCP
Cloud/GCP.description: Firebase and Flutter is a very cool combo. It has great material on how to work with and helpful docs. It makes creating a simple crud app in Flutter super easy.

Curiosity/Curiosity.title: Curiosity
Curiosity/Curiosity.description: - Information Noise Based upon N.N. Taleb, where more information will act as noise and disturb the signals.

CyberSecurity/CyberSecurity.title: CyberSecurity
CyberSecurity/CyberSecurity.description: Penetration testing is essentially simulating attacks and investigating the consequences of said attacks. The end goal is not to get hacked.

Database/Database.title: Database
Database/Database.description: In the context of business, everything is a database. Databases are the bedrock of how we design things nowadays.

Database/Snowflake.title: Snowflake
Database/Snowflake.description: Snowflake is a company providing a data warehouse.

Decision.title: Decision
Decision.description: In order to make better decisions, I try to structure and stabilize the process for making big decisions.  I define a big decision as a decision that will affect you every day of your life for no shorter than 3 months or for a large duration of time every year (Every weekend for the rest of the year for example). This means that things such as accepting a job offer and moving in with your spouse to a new place are categorized as big decisions.

DevOps/Git.title: Git
DevOps/Git.description: Git was developed by Linus Torvalds, who also developed the operating system Linux.  He jokingly said he named both tools after himself. Git was made because making changes and collaborating on Linux had become too challenging and a new way of doing version control was needed.

DevOps/GitHub Actions.title: GitHub Actions
DevOps/GitHub Actions.description: GitHub Actions are written in YAML file format. There are multiple ways of triggering GitHub actions, related to git-actions such as push/pull requests. But also cron schedules. It is a cheap and flexible way of doing simple jobs. One good advantage is that all the functions are in the same repo. One source of truth.

Economics/Economics.title: Economics
Economics/Economics.description: It is often called the dismal science. More than any other science, it is one of the most challenging sciences, as it is almost impossible to conduct experiments.

Economics/Investing.title: Investing
Economics/Investing.description: I find the thoughts of Vitaly Katelson on value investing quite interesting, as well as having a good and stable look at the value you invest in your life.

Entertainment/TV-Shows/Mad Men.title: 🚀  The show in 3 Sentences
Entertainment/TV-Shows/Mad Men.description: This show is about the sixties, and how people acted and behaved at the time. It is an interesting deep dive into the thoughts and attitudes at the time. It is also a deep dive into the changes happening at that time.

Entertainment/TV-Shows/The Wire.title: 🚀  The show in 3 Sentences
Entertainment/TV-Shows/The Wire.description: This show is not a typical cop show. The Wire is a show that looks at the war on drugs and the horrific consequences of it.  It is a show about people and institutions and how they relate to each other.

Entertainment/TV-Shows/TV-Shows.title: TV-Shows
Entertainment/TV-Shows/TV-Shows.description: TV shows have been my favorite way of seeing things. They are good to work on

Exercise/Exercise.title: Exercise
Exercise/Exercise.description: I try to exercise between 3 and 5 times a week. I try to separate between goals and expectations so that I can always reach for something hard to do.

Exercise/Flexibility/Flexibility.title: Flexibility
Exercise/Flexibility/Flexibility.description: I started working on flexibility far too late, but it is an awesome way of doing quick workouts at home.

Exercise/Strength/Strength.title: Strength Training
Exercise/Strength/Strength.description: I started strength training when I was 17, and did some on and off until I was 19. From 19 to 24, I consistently worked out between 3 and 5 days a week.  I did a lot of failing and needed a lot of guidance during that period. First of all, I started with only upper body exercises and neglected to work out my legs for quite a while. I think this was because I was not flexible enough to do the squat exercises correctly. In hindsight, it is difficult to assess in hindsight what the causation for the lack of leg exercises, but I am certain the lack of flexibility made doing leg workouts quite a bit difficult.

Food/Baking.title: Baking
Food/Baking.description: Baking is a bit differnt beast from cooking. Cooking is art, but baking is more of a science.

Food/Coffee.title: Coffee
Food/Coffee.description: Coffee is probably the drug I am most comfortable using. Caffeine is something I am definitely addicted to, and I am comfortable with that.

Food/Equipment.title: Equipment
Food/Equipment.description: In this article, I list the most important tools I use in the kitchen.  My philosophy for tools can be found in the tools section [[Tools]]

Food/Food.title: Food
Food/Food.description: One of the most important and fun aspects of cooking is the ability to explore outside of a set recipe. This exploration phase is what makes cooks great. Here is a list of questions for the aspiring cook.

Food/Recipes/Biryani.title: Description
Food/Recipes/Biryani.description: Biryani/Byriani is a Pakistani/Indian dish that is usually served at large gatherings. I did a lot of discovering and learning working with the guys in my apartment.

Food/Recipes/Crab Pasta.title: Description
Food/Recipes/Crab Pasta.description: Venetian Seafood pasta is the perfect summer meal for a couple of people, and it is easy to make quickly.

Food/Recipes/Maqlouba.title: Description
Food/Recipes/Maqlouba.description: Maqlouba means upside down in Arabic. It is quite easy to work with.  Actually, quite an easy dish to make for a lot of people, I might have spent around and hour maybe 90 minutes on it.

Food/Recipes/Osso Bucco.title: Description
Food/Recipes/Osso Bucco.description: Osso Buco is a traditional Italian dish that consists of braised veal shanks cooked with vegetables, white wine, and broth. The name "osso buco" translates to "bone with a hole" in English, which is a reference to the marrow-filled bone in the center of the veal shank.

Food/Recipes/Pasta.title: Pasta
Food/Recipes/Pasta.description: - Venetian Crab and Prosecco Linguine Pasta and Frutti di Mare :P, a delightful summer dish that is fresh and

Food/Recipes/Recipes.title: Philosophy
Food/Recipes/Recipes.description: I think following recipes automatically is a sign of an unimaginative mind, and as such one should try to experiment and expand the palette. I have structured my favorite and interesting recipes as a dynamic document with my thoughts and musing on the recipes. I want to be able to continuously update my recipes with more interesting

Food/Recipes/Recipes to try.title: Recipes to try
Food/Recipes/Recipes to try.description: - Carne Asada Looks like a good way to expand the Mexican cuisine.

Learning/Learning.title: Learning
Learning/Learning.description: I think learning is a difficult topic as it is extremely individual and is also one of the most important skills to have. Moreover, learning is a process as well, and in order to become a skilled learner you need to not only try different methods but also be able to evaluate yourself in a good and non-discriminate way.

Learning/Lectures.title: Lectures
Learning/Lectures.description: I try to use lectures on YouTube as a form of podcast, where I can listen to the lecturer while doing other things. I think this system is very good when it comes to most of the historical philosophical and social sciences; sometimes, it works okay for economics as well. I have not tried too much to listen to technical, mathematical, or engineering lectures.

Learning/Talks.title: Talks
Learning/Talks.description: List of talks that I have found intersting

Living/Home.title: Home
Living/Home.description: I like to have an orderly home but with a soul. A home is a reflection of who you are and the experiences you have had.

Mac/Alfred.title: Alfred
Mac/Alfred.description: Alfred is basically Spotlight on steroids. It contains all the features of Spotlight but is more powerful. If you purchase the powerpack, you also get access to workflows.

Mac/Karabiner.title: Karabiner
Mac/Karabiner.description: Karabiner is a powerful and customizable keyboard remapping tool designed specifically for macOS. It allows users to modify the behavior of their keyboards by remapping keys, creating shortcuts, and implementing various keyboard modifications. With Karabiner, users can redefine keys to perform different functions or assign complex combinations of keys to trigger specific actions. This enables users to personalize their keyboard layout and streamline their workflow, making it easier and more efficient to navigate through applications and perform tasks.

Mac/Mac.title: Mac
Mac/Mac.description: I switched from Windows to Mac in 2021 and used it privately until 2022 when I switched to a Mac for work as well.

Mac/Obsidian.title: Obsidian
Mac/Obsidian.description: Obsidian is the tool I use for storing information and writing down the experiences and knowledge I accumulate.

Mac/Terminal.title: Warp
Mac/Terminal.description: I started using Warp in May 2022, and it quickly became my terminal of choice. I find the most difficult thing when using the terminal is that it is often difficult to remember commands even though I "know" what I want to do. Warp is amazing at solving this gap by using AI capabilities and natural language to make doing terminal tasks easier.

Mathematics/Chaos.title: Chaos
Mathematics/Chaos.description: I discovered chaos partly through two main venues. The first is the teachings and works of Nassim Niclas Taleb, which are mainly concerned with uncertainty and rare events that pose risks.

Mathematics/Mathematics.title: Mathematics
Mathematics/Mathematics.description: Winning starts with knowing what game you're playing. Game theory is a fascinating concept, and one of the most important "case studies" is the prisoner's dilemma. Understanding mathematical optimal strategies is essential when understanding how the world works.

Motivation/Motivation.title: Motivation
Motivation/Motivation.description: Motivation for me is being able to intrinsically make the right decision. This implies that motivation is not driven by external factors in this definition. By removing external factors, motivation simply becomes a function of want and mental energy.

Music/Discover and Sharing.title: Discover and Sharing
Music/Discover and Sharing.description: I try to expand my musical horizon as much as possible. So that I can have music for all my moods and situations. Most of all, the music I discover is either through Spotify or YouTube, but sometimes I think that the best experiences are going to a festival or concert and getting introduced to new artists.

Obsidian/Obsidian.title: Obsidian
Obsidian/Obsidian.description: Obsidian is where I store my knowledge. I use it as a tool for writing, for storing information and knowledge, and for remembering. The main point of using obsidian is that it is living on your personal computer, can be treated as a good tool for writing quickly and also can be integrated with a lot of different tools, which probably is a huge advantage.

Personal.title: Personal
Personal.description: My Knowledge Wiki contains most of my knowledge (From 2023 onwards mostly). I try to gather all information I find interesting and my learnings in this wiki. The goal is to create a digital garden for my thoughts and share as much as possible of the things I find interesting. The goal is to have a comprehensive library for my thoughts and experiences that I can share with the world and look back on.

Philosophy/On The Duality of Rights and.id: Philosophy/On The Duality of Rights and Responsibilities
Philosophy/On The Duality of Rights and.title: On The Duality of Rights and Responsibilities
Philosophy/On The Duality of Rights and.description: Rights are made by and for humans, and can by definition therefore also be taken away from them. We create rights by fighting, bleeding and dying for them to be made and upheld. This is true for all major events where mankind has lept from darkness and abuse to a tiny bit lighter society.  By having rights, you in turn have to accept the responsibility of upholding those rights for yourself and also others.

Podcasts/Podcasts.title: Podcasts
Podcasts/Podcasts.description: I think podcasts are a cool way of getting to know more, it has some similar attributes to lectures in a way that information is vocally submitted.

Productivity/Productivity.title: Productivity
Productivity/Productivity.description: I am fascinated by productivity and always look for ways to increase my productivity. As I am only one person, I must maximize the amount of work I can do to the greatest extent possible.

Programming/Flutter.title: Dart
Programming/Flutter.description: To my knowledge, Dart is a beautiful language that is completely null-safe.

Programming/Javascript.title: Javascript
Programming/Javascript.description: Javascript is the most popular language in the world, so you should at least have some knowledge of how it works and how it functions.

Programming/Programming.title: Programming
Programming/Programming.description: I think an underrated aspect of programming is understanding computers, for engineers and self-taught programmers, it might be difficult to understand the intricacies of computers.

Programming/Python/FastAPI.title: FastAPI
Programming/Python/FastAPI.description: I like Fastapi as a backend service. It is very easy to learn and it is good when designing apis.

Programming/Python/Pytest.title: Pytest
Programming/Python/Pytest.description: Pytests is a wrapper around the unit test python test framework. It makes it a bit easier to write tests.

Thinking/Thinking.title: Thinking
Thinking/Thinking.description: Here, I write about ways of thinking about the world and the whys and hows. I am fascinated by how we as a species behave and act and how we can improve as a species.

Tools/ChatGPT.title: OpenAI
Tools/ChatGPT.description: GPT-4 is one of the best tools I have used in the last couple of years. It is astonishing technology that makes me more productive.

Tools/Tools.title: Tools
Tools/Tools.description: Tools are the things I use to accomplish tasks. A tool can both be a requirement and a supplement to myself.

Travel/Places/Bali.title: Description
Travel/Places/Bali.description: Bali is an Island in Indonesia. It is an excellent place to be, but it is full of tourists and digital nomads. There is almost a sub-culture there.

Travel/Places/Sapporo and Niseko.title: Description
Travel/Places/Sapporo and Niseko.description: Sapporo is a city in Hokkaido Japan. It is very far north, and it is cold there. It is also an excellent place to go skiing.  Sapporo is quite a big City, Niseko is more of a village with skiing slopes and some large resorts nearby.

Working/Management.title: Management
Working/Management.description: - Some work on the management from an engineering perspective

Working/Remote Work.title: Remote Work
Working/Remote Work.description: I did some remote working when I was at Bali, working primarily on my side projects. I felt like it is very difficult to motivate oneself if one does not have a social society or connection. It was fun however to experience new places.

Working/Working.title: Working
Working/Working.description: I have currently worked in different types of work. From being a driver to being a moving operator, to a warehouse Employee,  and finally, a Data Scientist.

Writing/Writing.title: Writing
Writing/Writing.description: Writing is hard.  It takes time, effort and experience. It is something that takes effort to even start.
